benchmark_details.name: SafeMindBench
benchmark_details.overview: SafeMindBench is a multimodal benchmark with 5,558 samples spanning four task categories (Instr-Risk, Env-Risk, Order-Fix, Req-Align) designed to systematically evaluate safety risks in embodied agents.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a rigorous evaluation suite that helps advance the systematic study and mitigation of safety risks in embodied LLM agents.

data.source: Dataset generated using LLMs and human verification, comprising various safety scenarios.
data.annotation: Generated via LLM synthesis followed by human verification.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the proportion of tasks completed without constraint violations and the successful completion of tasks as intended.
methodology.interpretation: Higher SR indicates better compliance with safety constraints; higher SuccR indicates successful task completion.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance compared against leading LLMs and embodied agent architectures.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments across various task scenarios.
